title: Chinese Government provides a RMB 3.6 million in grant funding — via two 2006 ETCAs — for the acquisition of computer equipment for Bolivia's Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Linked to Project ID#69366 and #69367)
description: Then, on or before October 16, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Bolivia signed letters of exchange in which the Chinese Government agreed to donate the computer equipment to boost the technological capacity of Bolivia's Foreign Ministry. The funds for this project were drawn from the two Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ETCAs) signed on April 27, 2006 (as captured by linked project ID#69366) and November 25, 2006 (as captured by linked project ID#69366). The Government of Bolivia exempted the equipment from taxes on July 29, 2009. The combined value of the grant funding from the ETCAs was RMB 3.6 million ($530,000 USD). China Radio & TV Co. provided the computer equipment, a server, computers, sound equipment, projectors and a phone system. The equipment was handed over on December 23, 2009.
staff_comments: The Spanish project title is Oferta Exterior Sino-Boliviana: Equipamiento informático de la Cancillería de Bolivia.As this project was funded by ETCAs, which is a financing mechanism specific to China's Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM), AidData has coded MOFCOM as the specific Chinese Government institution responsible for providing financing for this project.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Government provides a RMB 3.6 million in grant funding — via two 2006 ETCAs — for the acquisition of computer equipment for Bolivia's Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Linked to Project ID#69366 and #69367)

# Description
Then, on or before October 16, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Bolivia signed letters of exchange in which the Chinese Government agreed to donate the computer equipment to boost the technological capacity of Bolivia's Foreign Ministry. The funds for this project were drawn from the two Economic and Technical Cooperation Agreements (ETCAs) signed on April 27, 2006 (as captured by linked project ID#69366) and November 25, 2006 (as captured by linked project ID#69366). The Government of Bolivia exempted the equipment from taxes on July 29, 2009. The combined value of the grant funding from the ETCAs was RMB 3.6 million ($530,000 USD). China Radio & TV Co. provided the computer equipment, a server, computers, sound equipment, projectors and a phone system. The equipment was handed over on December 23, 2009.
justification: Project involves provision of computer equipment for government use, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Computer equipment, server, sound equipment, projectors, phone system for Ministry of Foreign Affairs

title: Chinese Government cancels RMB 40.3 million of the Government of Bolivia’s outstanding obligations
description: According to Bolivia’s Central Bank, on 24 April 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Bolivia signed a debt exemption protocol cancelling RMB 40.3 million of the Government of Bolivia’s outstanding debt obligations related to one or more previously contracted loans. The agreement was signed by China's Ambassador Zhao Wuyi and Foreign Minster Choquehuanca.
combined_text:
# Sector

# Title

# Description
According to Bolivia’s Central Bank, on 24 April 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Bolivia signed a debt exemption protocol cancelling RMB 40.3 million of the Government of Bolivia’s outstanding debt obligations related to one or more previously contracted loans. The agreement was signed by China's Ambassador Zhao Wuyi and Foreign Minster Choquehuanca.
justification: Debt cancellation agreement without specific project details or environmental implications
evidence: Debt exemption protocol, no project-specific details provided

title: Chinese Government provides a $300,000 USD grant for flood relief in Bolivia
description: On January 31, 2008, the Chinese Government provided a $300,000 USD grant to the Government of Bolivia for relief in response to the January floods in Bolivia. The donation was to be used for seeds and logistics to the affected population.
staff_comments: Project_status field was set to Completion because it is clear that all Chinese financing was disbursed.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government provides a $300,000 USD grant for flood relief in Bolivia

# Description
On January 31, 2008, the Chinese Government provided a $300,000 USD grant to the Government of Bolivia for relief in response to the January floods in Bolivia. The donation was to be used for seeds and logistics to the affected population.
justification: Project is humanitarian aid with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Flood relief grant for seeds and logistics, humanitarian focus

title: Chinese Government provides BWP 1.1 million grant for National Referral STD Treatment and Training Centre Construction Project
description: During the farewell ceremony for the 11th Chinese Medical Team in 2008, Health Minister, Ms Lesego Motsumi highlighted that the Chinese government has provided a grant of approximately BWP 1.1 million to finance the construction of the National Referral STD Treatment and Training Centre in Gaborone.

During the farewell ceremony for the 11th Chinese Medical Team in 2008, Health Minister, Ms Lesego Motsumi highlighted that the Chinese government has provided a grant of approximately BWP 1.1 million to finance the construction of the National Referral STD Treatment and Training Centre in Gaborone.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare infrastructure development with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Construction of STD treatment and training center, healthcare sector project

title: Chinese Government dispatches 12th medical team to Nyangabgwe Referral Hospital and Princess Marina Hospital
description: The Chinese Government has been sending medical teams to Botswana since 1981. Fujian Province has been responsible for sending the teams. On January 21, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Botswana signed an agreement, officially dispatching the 12th medical team to Botswana.   The 12th medical team consisted of 46 members (40 medical professionals and 6 support staff) who were stationed at Nyangabgwe Referral Hospital in the city of Francistown and Princess Marina Hospital in the city of Gaborone. The team completed its term of service between December 10, 2008 and 2011.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 12th medical team to Nyangabgwe Referral Hospital and Princess Marina Hospital

# Description
The Chinese Government has been sending medical teams to Botswana since 1981. Fujian Province has been responsible for sending the teams. On January 21, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Botswana signed an agreement, officially dispatching the 12th medical team to Botswana.   The 12th medical team consisted of 46 members (40 medical professionals and 6 support staff) who were stationed at Nyangabgwe Referral Hospital in the city of Francistown and Princess Marina Hospital in the city of Gaborone. The team completed its term of service between December 10, 2008 and 2011.
justification: Project focuses on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment to hospitals, healthcare services focus

title: Chinese Government provides P30 million grant for Botswana Botanical Gardens Project
description: On February 27, 2008 and March 4, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Botswana signed an exchange of notes regarding the Botswana Botanical Garden Project. The Chinese Government reportedly committed somewhere between P30 and P35 million in grant funding for this project. As of February 2010, the botanical gardens had still not been constructed, with their locations had not yet been decided. According to baike.com, the project is under construction.
staff_comments: AidData relies upon the more conservative of the two grant commitment estimates (P30 million). The Chinese project title is 援博植物园项目 or 我援博植物园项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
OTHER SOCIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND SERVICES

# Title
Chinese Government provides P30 million grant for Botswana Botanical Gardens Project

# Description
On February 27, 2008 and March 4, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Botswana signed an exchange of notes regarding the Botswana Botanical Garden Project. The Chinese Government reportedly committed somewhere between P30 and P35 million in grant funding for this project. As of February 2010, the botanical gardens had still not been constructed, with their locations had not yet been decided. According to baike.com, the project is under construction.
justification: Project focuses on botanical gardens, which are unrelated to energy or environmental impact
evidence: Botanical Gardens Project, social infrastructure focus, grant funding

title: Chinese Government restructures Botswana’s outstanding debt obligations through a maturity extension to an interest-free loan
description: On August 27, 2008 and October 9, 2008, the Chinese Government and the Government of Botswana signed an exchange of notes, which provided a maturity extension to an interest-free loan that the Government previously contracted with the Chinese Government.

title: China establishes the Confucius Institute in University of Estadual Paulista
description: On December 6, 2008, the University of Sao Paolo State University and Hubei built the first Confucius Institute in Sao Paolo. In July 2008, President Hu Jintao met with Brazilian President Lula to discuss the establishment of the institute. Vice Minister of Chinese Ministry of Education, Tian Shulan, Brazil and Pakistan Parliamentary Friendship Committee Mr Sun Rongmao Chinese consul general in Sao Paulo, party secretary of Hubei University Rayong root, Shu Jianping Cultural Counselor of Chinese Embassy in Brazil, Sao Paulo State University Makeni, the Confucius Institute Friendly Committee counsel Xiluonuoya (WTO arbitrators) and more than 300 local community celebrities attended the opening ceremony.  This institute will serve as a platform for more informed exchange between China and Brazil. As of 2008, China had set up 305 Confucius Institutes in 78 countries.  As of 2013, the institute was still growing and developing as a cultural education center.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China establishes the Confucius Institute in University of Estadual Paulista

# Description
On December 6, 2008, the University of Sao Paolo State University and Hubei built the first Confucius Institute in Sao Paolo. In July 2008, President Hu Jintao met with Brazilian President Lula to discuss the establishment of the institute. Vice Minister of Chinese Ministry of Education, Tian Shulan, Brazil and Pakistan Parliamentary Friendship Committee Mr Sun Rongmao Chinese consul general in Sao Paulo, party secretary of Hubei University Rayong root, Shu Jianping Cultural Counselor of Chinese Embassy in Brazil, Sao Paulo State University Makeni, the Confucius Institute Friendly Committee counsel Xiluonuoya (WTO arbitrators) and more than 300 local community celebrities attended the opening ceremony.  This institute will serve as a platform for more informed exchange between China and Brazil. As of 2008, China had set up 305 Confucius Institutes in 78 countries.  As of 2013, the institute was still growing and developing as a cultural education center.
justification: Project focuses on cultural and educational exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Establishment of Confucius Institute for cultural education and exchange between China and Brazil

title: COSCO provides $80 million vendor credit for Sevan Brasil (Linked to Project ID#92532)
description: In 2008, the Sevan Brasil drilling rig was ordered from China COSCO Shipping Corporation Limited (COSCO) by Sevan Drilling ASA. Sometime between this order and December 31, 2009, COSCO provided an $80 million vendor (seller's) credit to Sevan Drilling Rig II Pte Ltd., an indirectly owned subsidiary of Sevan Drilling ASA and the owner and operator of the Sevan Brasil drill. The loan matures January 1, 2015 and has an annual interest of 9.0% pay in kind.  Sevan Brasil was contracted to Petrobras on a six-year drilling contract for operations off the coast of Brazil and was built in 2012 in the COSCO Shipyard in China. At delivery of Sevan Brasil in 2012, a final payment of $26.5 million to COSCO was deferred and subsequently funded from the USD 80 million vendor credit arrangement. As such, there is only evidence for $26.5 million being drawn down from the vendor credit.  The rig was additionally funded by a $525 million syndicated loan that included a contribution from China Construction Bank (captured via Project ID#92532).  The Sevan Brasil drill is a 6th generation Sevan 650 DP semi-submersible offshore drilling rig. Sevan Brasil completed acceptance testing and commenced work under its six year contract on July 24, 2012.   Then, on September 24, 2012 Sevan Brasil experienced problems with the blow-out preventer (‘BOP’) control system. It was later discovered that the BOP control system was damaged due to human error during installation and testing. The BOP was sent to the manufacturer for repair. Then, on October 22, 2012, Sevan Drilling ASA announced an agreement with Petrobras to use Sevan Brasil for alternative work, not requiring the BOP. The rig worked on a reduced rate of 80% from the day of the announcement. On November 13, 2012, Sevan Drilling ASA announced that Sevan Brasil had completed drilling of the top-hole section and moved back to the original location. Repair of the BOP was completed and functionally tested on the rig floor. On November 16, 2012, Sevan Drilling ASA announced that testing of the BOP for Sevan Brasil had been completed and accepted by Petrobras and that the rig was back on full day rate as of 09:00 a.m. CET the same date.
staff_comments: 1. The date the vendor financing was committed is unknown. In financial statements for Quarter 4 of 2009, the credit was said to be unused, and the order was put in for the Sevan Brasil drill with COSCO in 2008. As such, the financing was likely committed in either 2008 or 2009.2. Sevan Drilling Rig II Pte Ltd is a special purpose vehicle that is legally incorporated in Singapore created for the construction and management of the Sevan Brasil drill. It is an indirectly and wholly owned subsidiary of Sevan Drilling ASA, a public limited liability company organized under the laws of Norway and international offshore drilling contractor specializing in ultra deep water rigs. Sevan Marine ASA was formerly the parent company of Sevan Drilling ASA, but in December 2011, Sevan Marine was acquired by Seadrill Ltd. Thus, Seadrill became the owner of 28.52% of Sevan Drilling ASA's shares, becoming the largest shareholder. For an in-depth discussion of the company's ownership structure and mechanism for contracting with Petrobras, see pages 69-73 of the Sevan Drilling ASA bond prospectus dated February 12, 2013.
combined_text:
# Sector
INDUSTRY, MINING, CONSTRUCTION

# Title
COSCO provides $80 million vendor credit for Sevan Brasil (Linked to Project ID#92532)

# Description
In 2008, the Sevan Brasil drilling rig was ordered from China COSCO Shipping Corporation Limited (COSCO) by Sevan Drilling ASA. Sometime between this order and December 31, 2009, COSCO provided an $80 million vendor (seller's) credit to Sevan Drilling Rig II Pte Ltd., an indirectly owned subsidiary of Sevan Drilling ASA and the owner and operator of the Sevan Brasil drill. The loan matures January 1, 2015 and has an annual interest of 9.0% pay in kind.  Sevan Brasil was contracted to Petrobras on a six-year drilling contract for operations off the coast of Brazil and was built in 2012 in the COSCO Shipyard in China. At delivery of Sevan Brasil in 2012, a final payment of $26.5 million to COSCO was deferred and subsequently funded from the USD 80 million vendor credit arrangement. As such, there is only evidence for $26.5 million being drawn down from the vendor credit.  The rig was additionally funded by a $525 million syndicated loan that included a contribution from China Construction Bank (captured via Project ID#92532).  The Sevan Brasil drill is a 6th generation Sevan 650 DP semi-submersible offshore drilling rig. Sevan Brasil completed acceptance testing and commenced work under its six year contract on July 24, 2012.   Then, on September 24, 2012 Sevan Brasil experienced problems with the blow-out preventer (‘BOP’) control system. It was later discovered that the BOP control system was damaged due to human error during installation and testing. The BOP was sent to the manufacturer for repair. Then, on October 22, 2012, Sevan Drilling ASA announced an agreement with Petrobras to use Sevan Brasil for alternative work, not requiring the BOP. The rig worked on a reduced rate of 80% from the day of the announcement. On November 13, 2012, Sevan Drilling ASA announced that Sevan Brasil had completed drilling of the top-hole section and moved back to the original location. Repair of the BOP was completed and functionally tested on the rig floor. On November 16, 2012, Sevan Drilling ASA announced that testing of the BOP for Sevan Brasil had been completed and accepted by Petrobras and that the rig was back on full day rate as of 09:00 a.m. CET the same date.
justification: The project involves financing for an offshore drilling rig used for oil exploration, which directly supports fossil fuel extraction
evidence: Sevan Brasil drilling rig, contracted to Petrobras for offshore drilling operations, blow-out preventer system for oil drilling
